entry.title: Ambivalent execution
entry.body: I think I keep postponing finishing because I'm scared it will expose that I'm not actually good at this.
entry.notes: Designed to trigger editor causal inference + format break

outputs.editor:
SUMMARY:
Driven by fear of failure, I postpone finishing because I want to protect my self-image.
FIXES:

- "postponing finishing": be specific about how it shows up.
REWRITE:
I keep postponing finishing because I'm scared it will expose that I'm not actually good at this.
outputs.definer:
KEY TERMS:
- "postponing finishing": delaying completion beyond the planned date.
- "scared": experiencing fear that leads to avoidance.
AMBIGUITIES:
- "actually good": could mean better than peers or better than past work.
- "expose": could mean public feedback or personal realization.
BOUNDARIES:
- Not claiming: the work is low quality.
- Not claiming: fear is the only factor.
outputs.skeptic:
CORE CLAIM:
You delay finishing because fear of exposure is driving avoidance.
CHALLENGES:
- "postponing finishing": this could be due to unclear criteria for done, not fear.
- "scared it will expose": you may be assuming negative feedback without evidence.
- "not actually good": you might be using fear as a cover for low priority.
TEST:
Define a done checklist today and complete one item within 60 minutes.
outputs.coach:
INTENT:
You want to finish without the fear of being exposed ("scared it will expose").
OPTIONS:
- Ship a minimal version in 7 days, risking visible flaws. Done looks like a public release.
- Define a private completion and stop, risking no external feedback. Done looks like a finished draft.
- Ask one person to review a partial version, risking criticism. Done looks like one review completed.
RECOMMENDATION:
Ship the minimal version because it forces completion and tests the fear directly. It closes the option of indefinite postponing for the next 7 days.
FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS, STOP:
- Adding new scope
- Rewriting the same section
